decks.notes: The main concept of this Merfolk aggro deck is to utilize the tribal synergy and tempo plays offered by Merfolk creatures to apply early pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan. By using cards like Aether Vial, Spreading Seas, and Lord of Atlantis, the deck aims to control the board while steadily building a strong board presence. Cards like Dismember and Harbinger of the Tides provide removal options and bounce effects to deal with threats, allowing the deck to maintain aggression and outmaneuver the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) in order to generate a large amount of mana and cast powerful colorless Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers. The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells like Oblivion Stone and Karn Liberated, while using cards like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map to find the necessary lands. With threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through sheer power and advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by taxing their resources and slowing them down while deploying aggressive threats like Eldrazi creatures. By combining disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter with powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, this deck aims to pressure the opponent while making it difficult for them to cast spells or search their library for answers. The deck also includes removal spells like Dismember and Chalice of the Void to deal with threats efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards that can boost the power and toughness of creatures on the battlefield, such as Hardened Scales and Steel Overseer. By increasing the counters on creatures like Hangarback Walker and Walking Ballista, the deck can quickly build a threatening board presence. Additionally, cards like Throne of Geth and Arcbound Ravager help to further enhance the effectiveness of the deck by allowing for easy manipulation of counters. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful, growing creatures and seal the game quickly through aggressive plays.

The deck focuses on quickly putting out aggressive threats such as Vengevine, Hollow One, and Flamewake Phoenix. By utilizing discard effects like Goblin Lore and Faithless Looting, the deck can quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures to bring back with Vengevine. Reckless Bushwhacker and Burning-Tree Emissary allow for explosive starts and big swings in damage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault, utilizing the graveyard as a resource to maintain pressure and secure victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while building a board presence with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter to slow down the opponent's plays, and Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, the deck aims to control the battlefield. Drogskol Captain and Selfless Spirit provide protection for your creatures, ensuring that your aggressive strategy can continue unimpeded. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of disruptive elements and evasive threats, ultimately securing a victory through consistent pressure.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with large creatures like Desert Cerodon, Horror of the Broken Lands, and Monstrous Carabid, then cast Living End to bring them back onto the battlefield for a powerful combo finish. Cards like Violent Outburst and Demonic Dread help cascade into Living End, while Faerie Macabre can disrupt opponent's graveyard strategies. Fulminator Mage can also disrupt opponent's lands, adding another layer of control to the deck. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with hasty creatures and outvalue them with resource denial.

This deck revolves around creating a powerful, unblockable creature that is protected by a variety of auras that enhance its power and provide Hexproof. By quickly buffing up a creature like Slippery Bogle or Gladecover Scout with cards like Rancor, Ethereal Armor, and Daybreak Coronet, the deck aims to deal consistent damage to the opponent while being nearly impossible to remove or block thanks to Hexproof and protection spells like Leyline of Sanctity. With a mix of aura enchantments and protection cards, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, evasive threat.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly with cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer, while digging through the deck with cantrips like Serum Visions and Opt. The goal is to set up a big turn where you use cards like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual to generate a lot of mana, then use Grapeshot to target the opponent multiple times and win the game. Gifts Ungiven is a key card in this strategy, allowing you to search for the perfect combination of cards to set up your storm turn.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive human creatures backed up by disruptive spells like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage. By utilizing Aether Vial and creatures that benefit from each other entering the battlefield, the deck can quickly build a threatening board presence. The inclusion of mana-fixing lands and Noble Hierarch allows for smooth and consistent mana acceleration, while Thalia, Guardian of Thraben provides additional disruption to slow down the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck focuses on synergy and tempo to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

The focus of this deck is to quickly cheat big creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Through the Breach. The deck also utilizes cards like Faithless Looting and Serum Visions to set up the combo, while using instant speed removal like Lightning Axe and Izzet Charm to control the game. The goal is to reanimate a huge threat and swing for game-winning damage in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures before they have a chance to react.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells and removing threats with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Maelstrom Pulse. The deck aims to ramp up its mana quickly with cards like Search for Tomorrow and Sakura-Tribe Elder in order to cast powerful spells like Scapeshift and Bring to Light, which allow for explosive plays to win the game. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Cryptic Command for extra versatility and card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on opponents while disrupting their game plan through cards like Leonin Arbiter and Ghost Quarter. It aims to disrupt mana bases and resource management with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, while also generating value through creatures like Eternal Witness and Collected Company. The deck can also out-value opponents through cards like Scavenging Ooze and Gavony Township, while also having a resilient threat in Mirran Crusader. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive in its approach while also disrupting opponents' strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly by cycling through artifacts and sacrificing them with Krark-Clan Ironworks to draw cards, loop artifacts, and eventually win the game through The Antiquities War or other win conditions like Pyrite Spellbomb or Ichor Wellspring. The deck also incorporates cards like Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever to manipulate the graveyard and bring back key pieces. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently while controlling the board with cards like Engineered Explosives.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Eldrazi Temple and Noble Hierarch in order to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. Aggression is key, utilizing cards like Bloodbraid Elf and Lightning Bolt to quickly finish off opponents. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Dismember and Eldrazi Obligator to control the board and maintain pressure. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficient mana usage and aggressive creature plays to overwhelm opponents in a fast-paced Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this Ad Nauseam combo deck is to use cards like Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw your entire deck, then win by playing Laboratory Maniac and drawing a card. The deck focuses on fast mana generation with cards like Gemstone Mine and Lotus Bloom, while also protecting your combo with Pact of Negation. Using cards like Spoils of the Vault allows you to search for specific combo pieces. The goal is to assemble your combo quickly and win before your opponent can disrupt your plan.
